Cluster 1 summary (MPNet+T5):
, but it was not cold, and the body was not cold. a woman deposed that she lived near the beach and was standing at the door of her cottage. she deposed that she lived near the shore and was waiting for the return of the fishermen. they found that the clothes were not wet and even that the body was not cold. they carried it to the cottage of an old woman near the spot and endeavoured, but in vain, to restore it to life.

Cluster 2 summary (MPNet+T5):
,,,,,, 22 Chapter 23 Chapter 24 Letter 1 _To Mrs. Saville, England._ St. Petersburgh, Dec. 11th, 17—. I arrived here yesterday, and my first task is to assure my dear sister of my welfare and increasing confidence in my undertaking. I am already far north of London, and as I walk in the streets of Petersburgh, I feel a cold northern breeze play upon my cheeks, which braces my nerves and fills me with

Cluster 4 summary (MPNet+T5):
, and I felt a little regret on learning that my uncle had forbidden me to embark in a seafaring life. I accompanied the whale-fishers on several expeditions to the North Sea. I voluntarily endured cold, famine, thirst, and want of sleep; I often worked harder than the common sailors during the day.
---
